qas.question: What has some responsibility for offering variety in what we eat?
What is the variety of alleles within a single species?
When do we rely on agricultural diversity to replant the land with something new?

answers.text: If a crop fails in a monoculture

qas.question: What can destroy a wheat crop?
What type of a society primarily grows monocultures?
What has some responsibility for offering variety in monoculture?
What is the variety of alleles within a single production area?

plausible_answers.text: If a crop fails in a monoculture

qas.question: When do we rely on production diversity to replant the land with something new?
What can destroy a single species?
What type of a society primarily grows wheat?

context: <a0_0><a1_0><b5_0>Interspecific crop diversity<b5_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> is, in part, responsible for offering variety in what we eat. <b6_0>Intraspecific diversity<b6_0/>, the variety of alleles within a single species, also offers us choice in our diets. <a2_0><b7_0>If a crop fails in a monoculture<b7_0/><a2_0/>, we rely on agricultural diversity to replant the land with something new. If a wheat crop is destroyed by <a3_0><b8_0>a pest<b8_0/><a3_0/> we may plant a hardier variety of wheat the next year, relying on intraspecific diversity. We may forgo wheat production in that area and plant a different species altogether, relying on interspecific diversity. Even an <a4_0><b9_0>agricultural society<b9_0/><a4_0/> which primarily grows monocultures, relies on biodiversity at some point.
